Clawâ€™s core purpose is simple: it remembers everything you copy, giving you instant access to a configurable history of your last 100 (or more!) copied items.

What makes Claw stand out, particularly for the Linux power user, is its deep commitment to compatibility and speed. It seamlessly bridges the gap between older X11 environments (using `xclip`) and modern Wayland setups (using `wl_clipboard`), ensuring a consistent experience no matter your desktop environment. This cross-platform design is crucial for developers who switch between different machines or window managers frequently.

This level of customization ensures the tool feels integrated into your workflow, not just bolted on.
